intro: Eremostachys sanguinea, commonly known as the redstem eremostachys, is a flowering plant native to arid and semi-arid regions of Central Asia. It is a perennial herb with gray-green, woolly foliage that helps it retain moisture in harsh environments. The plant produces striking red or purple flowers that bloom in late summer, attracting pollinators such as bees and butterflies. Its small, fibrous roots allow it to thrive in well-drained soils and withstand periods of drought. Eremostachys sanguinea is often used in xeriscaping due to its low water requirements and ornamental value.
